verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. How long wilt thou forget <WH7911> me, O LORD <WH3068>? for ever <WH5331>? how long wilt thou hide <WH5641> thy face <WH6440> from me? chief: or, overseer
How long shall I take <WH7896> counsel <WH6098> in my soul <WH5315>, having sorrow <WH3015> in my heart <WH3824> daily <WH3119>? how long shall mine enemy <WH341> be exalted <WH7311> over me?
Consider <WH5027> and hear <WH6030> me, O LORD <WH3068> my God <WH430>: lighten <WH215> mine eyes <WH5869>, lest I sleep <WH3462> the sleep of death <WH4194>;
Lest mine enemy <WH341> say <WH559>, I have prevailed <WH3201> against him; and those that trouble <WH6862> me rejoice <WH1523> when I am moved <WH4131>.
But I have trusted <WH982> in thy mercy <WH2617>; my heart <WH3820> shall rejoice <WH1523> in thy salvation <WH3444>.
I will sing <WH7891> unto the LORD <WH3068>, because he hath dealt bountifully <WH1580> with me.
